title: Trump revokes key climate finding, dismantling legal basis for emissions rules
subhead: The US president is scrapping the landmark 2009 finding that greenhouse gases threaten human life by warming the planet. The move is expected to face swift legal challenges.

title: Germany and France now publicly display their disagreements over Macron's proposals
Macron accused of weakening France's institutions with loyalist appointments
Europeans consider resuming direct talks with Putin on Ukraine
subhead: Opinions remain divided over both the appropriateness and the terms of the proposal championed by Emmanuel Macron to re-establish dialogue with Russia, even though such a prospect is no longer considered taboo.

title: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial ends with political uncertainty as defense urges 'tolerance' for legal 'gray areas'
subhead: The Paris appeals court will deliver its ruling on July 7. The far-right leader has stated that the court's decision will influence whether or not she runs in the 2027 presidential election.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Fournier Beaudry and Cizeron claim ice dance gold in mesmerizing performance
subhead: The French-Canadian duo dazzled spectators at the Milan ice rink on Wednesday, achieving their audacious goal of Olympic gold just one year after forming their partnership.

title: Ice hockey at the 2026 Olympics: A mountain sport looks to win over France's big cities
subhead: The majority of players on the French national team hail from urban centers. This shift reflects the changing landscape of the sport across the country.

Kremlin confirms that WhatsApp is banned in Russia

2026 could quickly become deadliest year for migrants crossing the Mediterranean
Ukrainian skeleton racer Heraskevych banned from Winter Olympics over memorial helmet
'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhead: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

title: Emmanuel Macron: 'Now is the time for the EU to launch a joint borrowing capacity, through eurobonds'
subhead: Two days ahead of a meeting of European Union heads of state and government in Brussels, the French president calls on the 27 member states, in an interview with Le Monde and several other European newspapers, to make joint investments in protecting the environment, as well as in artificial intelligence and quantum technology, to avoid falling behind.

title: How the Epstein scandal brought down Jack Lang
subhead: The emblematic minister from President François Mitterrand's era was forced to step down as president of the Arab World Institute in Paris. Former allies and rivals have begun to speak out about a man who used his influence and network to maintain a lavish lifestyle.

title: French police's interactions with youth is a question of security and equality

The urgent need for a European strategy on economic sovereignty
